context: Deferred Compensation Plan We have a non-qualified deferred compensation plan that allows a group of employees within the U.S. to contribute base salary and commissions or incentive compensation on a tax deferred basis in excess of the IRS limits imposed on 401(k) plans. The marketable securities related to these investments are held in a Rabbi Trust. The related deferred compensation plan assets and liabilities under the non-qualified deferred compensation plan were as follows (in millions):

questions.26c8f65c-7246-42e5-b2aa-e9070c8d5d6b: What does the company's compensation plan allow?
questions.659e3bb7-d175-4125-91a0-76056b63ae4b: What was the Deferred compensation plan assets in 2018?
questions.6a84c519-8f4b-4f03-a94b-0f234d16b438: What were the other long-term liabilities in 2019?
questions.206dac28-1ba0-4741-97b2-5ab02b343456: What was the change in Deferred compensation plan assets between 2018 and 2019?
questions.9406b211-17a1-4a97-a646-a57170b7e270: What was the sum of Accrued expenses and Other long-term liabilities in 2019?
questions.0388b022-13e2-4eac-93b3-f6ded1b9fb67: What was the percentage change in Other long-term liabilities between 2018 and 2019?
